741147.name: Joseph Walsh
comments: Passionate and experienced in teaching concepts of local ecology.

Class is confusing and all his assessments are basically short answer and must include every single point to get full points... Many times instructions of the question doesn't even tell you how much to include in the answer so you have to just guess how much you need to write... Not a fan

Bs's through every lecture. Appears as if he's seeing his power point presentation for the first time. Exams/quizzes poorly worded=you lose points. Forget about asking a question, you'll be even more confused.Lecture a waste of time. Selected textbook horrible.You will have sleepless nights/restless days.Keep up with the readings. Be good at stats.

1102127.name: Jannet Chang
comments: she's great
no

905107.name: Adina Ott
comments: Dr. Ott is a great chemistry professor. She is very throrough at explaining if you dont understand, and like others mentioned, she makes herself available for you. Quizzes are every week, but not bad because its material u just learned and you have time to study. I would recommend her for CHM 120.

Most people in my class failed her initial midterm. She is clearly passionate about chemistry, but has some time management issues, which makes it hard for her to explain things in an appropriate manner. She tries to be helpful and accessable but kind of fails. =/ Really nice though! However, I doubt I'd recommend her.

Great professor. Organized, accessible and professional. Communicates ideas clearly and concisely. Lectures were never dull. Exams are challenging but conquerable (well ... most of them) if you study hard.
She is really organized and is very good at explaining. She is willing to help you if you ask for it. Graded exams and quizzes are returned quickly.

I got into a car accident on the day of the quiz and came in late. Not only i wasnt allowed to retake the quiz at a later time, but i was asked to complete as much as i can and submit with everyone else. I solved all but one problem and had points deducted for that one missing answer. A police report from my accident was of no use! Tough lady! heh

Dr. Ott is a great teacher! She might not do a very good job at explaining but if you go back to the book it will make a lot of sense. She is helpful and really nice. I actually overslept for the final exam and she called me to wake me up! Obviously a really caring teacher for those that care about the class! I recommend her!

She's dull. She is great at taking notes of the lectures, but I can do that. She doesn't really understand the material, or if she does, she does a terrible job at teaching it. She is extremely straightforward, because she reads off her notes. She often has trouble solving her own problems, and is really useless to visit out of class.
She is really knowledgeable, and her notes are very clear. Northwestern is lucky to have her. By the way this rating is for her summer class at CLC
Wonderful teacher. Really great at explaining things. Gives great examples.

She is a good teacher. She is organized and very well prepared. There are no barriers to learning in this class. Read the book, do the hw, go to class, take notes and it is easy to get an A. Don't expect any pity from her if you don't attend class regularly or don't do the hw. She is totally complacent about her student's progress in the class.

Hey, she might be snarky (seriously -- why mock people's grades? That's cold, Miss Lady) but she's smart, clear, and pedagogically sound. It's challenging, but you're taking this 'cause you want to go to med/dent/some other All-Growed-Up school. So suck it up, study hard, and you'll be well prepared by Doc Ott.
No Comments

1912216.name: Chad Bhatti
comments: Prof. Bhatti provides good instruction that is rarely followed. In my experience people have said that he does not give feedback. However, EVERY instance of feedback that he did provide was NOT heeded by students. People focus on how he presents information not the information that he provides. If I need trustworthy information, he is first.

Expect 100% self learning in this class, mostly through the text book and other resources. Very little feedback on assignments, mostly pertaining to form and not substance. Video lectures are uninspired, with very low production values, and are essentially a reading our loud of the text book materials.

Expect to learn from the textbook and receive little to no help from Dr. Bhatti. I asked for help after spending about 25 hours per week doing reading and assignments and he told me to watch his lecture videos twice. Additionally, be careful of the questions you ask--he can be very harsh if he thinks your question is stupid.

Professor Bhatti might be a machine learning algorithm. Taking this class is like interacting with Siri. Grading is automated and he follows a rubric that is highly inflexible, in really silly ways. It's laughably easy to get around his 7 discussion post requirement per week. On the plus side, he provides great references and resources.
Very boring course. Essentially a lot of book reading. Very little to no lecture or interaction provided.

1912218.name: Donald Wedding
comments: Don is excellent and he shares a wealth of resources. He is very knowledgeable and realistic about what is possible and what is expected. He is very supportive if you do the work. He gave a significant amount of his time outside the course to discuss options for furthering studies after completing the MSDS. I highly recommend Professor Wedding.
Is extremely good at engaging and teaching people at different levels.
Just take him for PREDICT 411 and you'll be glad you did.
Great professor. Very engaged with students. He is really helping the students to learn the material than just giving out grades.

Amazing instructor. Very engaged. Always available to help. The class overall lacked much educational material in the form of lectures. It was still mainly read the book and run the SAS code. But he reviewed the homework towards the end of each week which was helpful in understaning the material.

1651618.name: Laura Kipnis
comments: Laura Kipnis presented one of the most engaging, well organized, incisive classes I took during pursuit of my MFA. The readings were outstanding. The discussions were relevant and enlightening. And she tackled very difficult topics with careful consideration. I wish more professors followed her lead.
Nice teacher!! Easy class, though you tend not to learn too much. Very discussion based. Kipnis is a kind woman, and generally pretty lenient.
Truly, the worst teacher I've ever had.

2060974.name: Nicole Najor
comments: Her lectures were dry, boring, and dull. Tests and quizzes were freaking hard. A lot of tricky questions. She doesn't curve. Doesn't care and help student when you ask her a question. She made this class way too difficult for no reason. Her lectures were nearly useless for the exam. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. IGNORE.

Difficult course material, but so worth the effort! I learned A LOT in this class and retained the majority of information studied. Dr. Najor really went above and beyond in making herself available for office hours and after class. As a science student, I can't say I've had a more down to earth professor than her. Would definitely recommend!

Totally ruined a subject! The lectures were boring. Lots of tricky questions in quizzes and exams, which didn't not fairly reflect what you have learned. Tons of frustration has been built during the quarter. She refuse to give extra credits or curve the grade to motivate her students. For the sake of your GPA and your mental health, avoid her!

The only people who do well already work in the field or have taken it before. The weekly quizzes (as well as her exams) are very difficult, and do not cover what she covers in class. She wants to be helpful, but is the opposite. Presents false info. Won't give extra credit, and will take no blame for everyone doing poorly. Avoid at all costs!

Has great personality for teaching, but doesn't have a mastery of the topic & doesn't assess the class appropriately. The quizzes require that you read the chapter with a fine-toothed comb. Even using her study guide, lecture, my notes, and re-reading the chapter, quizzes are difficult to do a C. Only current med professionals/re-take get As.

Ruined a subject I actually find interesting. She not only presents incorrect material occasionally, but also gives exam length quizzes each class. She says they're only on the lecture, but sends an outline that contains significantly more material NOT present in lecture or slides. No extra credit or curving so as to "keep us motivated." Horrible.

1979884.name: Daniel Roth
comments: Grading often based on his opinions and his perspective
Provides inconsistent grading. The feedback he provides often doesnt make sense and nitpicks on things he can find.

Who 'doesn't do email' with an online course? Constant complaints about how many students he has to teach. BS assignments and overemphasis on discussion boards with really generic questions: 'What makes a good manager?'

Unclear guidelines and not very good at explaining anything. Not very understanding of the concerns of the students, but just talks about what he wants from the students. Pretty much the worst professor I've had. I emailed him with questions and he answers easy questions, but just stops replying if he doesn't like anything from the email.

158995.name: Moshe Matalon
comments: Pretty terrible with class content. Acts like everything is really simple when it's actually super confusing. Just seems to have forgotten what it's like to be a student.
No Comments
greatest professor ever. we love moshe. more moshe...less vaughan.

356973.name: Paul Goerss
comments: I had Prof Goerss at Wellesley College. I loved his classes. His lectures were clear and his notes were great. I am now a lecturer at a university and while I am nowhere near as good as Prof Goerss, I try to emulate his teaching style. I am very glad that he was at Wellesley when I was. Thank you Prof Goerss.
I loved Professor Goerss when I had him at Wellesley. I had him for many classes. His lectures were clear, his tests were fair, and his jokes were goofy :)

Goerss is exceptionally clear in his lectures. He doesn't follow the book so the assignments he gives from Hatcher's Algebraic Topology are difficult. You realize how clear he was after the fact though.

1144840.name: David Rapp
comments: This class was really interesting and Professor Rapp teaches really well. He's so engaged and interested in what he's discussing, and he's genuinely interested in making sure the student understand everything as well. It's also cool that he's a teacher and researcher (and great at both), because he has a very practical understanding of the subject.
No Comments

556460.name: Jane Winston
comments: She's fascinating, but tough.
No Comments
No Comments

1120463.name: Victor Yampolsky
comments: Yes, he is not the nicest person in the world.. but nobody says anything to him because he's really THAT talented. He catches every single detail and doesn't let mistakes go. I have a lot of respect for him.. but if I didn't I probably didn't take this class. He can get very.. mean..

A good conductor but a bad teacher. If you want to listen to his sacarsm and being insulted or got mad at, join the NUSO. Rehearsals are dull. Excusing people from rehearsals are handled case by case, that means he may not excuse you for any reason if he does not like you. He just concerned about his own performance and achievement, NOT YOU!

1112264.name: Brian Uzzi
comments: This professor has students he likes and those he does not – is you are the latter do not bother to go to class. Insecure aging professor who should not be teachings in a leading school. Everything is prepared before class, even the dry jokes.
Makes stuff up when he answers question. Very erratic way of running a classroom.
No Comments

161076.name: Jeffrey Winters
comments: He is one of the best Profesor in the world. I was impressed that he also took part with john pilger video about Indonesia. He's smart, prestigious, and handsome guy. God bless you and your family Jeffrey

Professor Winters is very well versed in his field and a fantastic teacher. His 'Politics of Human Rights' course is highly recommended to anyone with interest in the subject or poly sci or history majors in general. Also a very accommodating prof and all-around nice guy. This was not the easiest class I have taken but I learned a lot. Thanks!
Boo to the boo'er of Winters, you abuser of human rights. Try hanging out in Indonesia, learning the language, then hammering on human rights issues. He eats human rights abusers for breakfast
Winters is a wonderful prof. Very entertaining, with lots of knowledge to share. First class I've really missed badly after it was over. Take courses with Winters if you can.
boo to winters
No Comments

1313908.name: Bruce Ankenman
comments: GOOD TEACHER

Ankenman is a very dedicated professor and he works hard to make sure that his students have a thorough and complete understanding of statistics for engineers. Unlike other professors he stresses the ability to apply what you have learned. Great class!

159339.name: Martina Bode
comments: She is the best! She explains complicated concepts extremely well and puts them in a way her students can understand. Finally - I understand how to conquer word problems!!
Sweet, clear, fabulous fabulous fabulous. Take her classes, give her apples. She's the best.
Amazing teacher, amazing woman!
Great prof. Her enthusiasm for calculus amazes me. Even if you're not quite the math buff, you'll be able to do fairly decent in her class.
SOOO NICE
No Comments

176531.name: Michael Roloff
comments: Roloff is absolutely incredible! His lectures are hilarious and very interesting--time passes by so quickly in his class. You have take a course with him while at Northwestern!

This guy is the man - highly recommend him. I was afraid of taking his class, as I just finished my junior year and this class was to be my first college course. I was proved wrong. He's funny, relatable, smart (dude never looks at anything while he lectures), engaging. Quite possibly the best teacher I've ever had.

Theories of Persuasion was the best class I have ever taken! Professor Roloff connected class material to everyday life in a way that was as intellectually stimulating as it was enjoyable. He is incredibly helpful, hilarious, and very attentive to students' needs. I would highly recommend taking any of his classes!

Wow what a professor! This is why you come to a school the caliber of Northwestern to meet and be taught by professors like Roloff. One of the best experiences you will have at NU is his change management class. He is very funny, witty, and engaging. A definite take and an easy A for a catharsis paper.

This is one of the best professors at NU, funny, knows his stuff and extreemly helpful. Take this class and you will not be disappointed at all. Did I mention that he is extreemly well respected and very inspirational. Long live Roloff.
Took his theories of persuasion class over the summer, one of the most amazing professors I have ever had! Take his class!
I had him for a theories of persuasion class over the summer. He will not let you down!

An outstanding teacher with an interesting perspective. A little much to take at first but once you figure out who he is the class is great. Very entertaining and more importantly educational. Really takes the time when grading papers to give feedback. Lectures are very involved but he provides outlines which make note taking so much easier.
He'll keep you laughing

It's 22 years since my negotiation and communication theory classes with Mike Roloff.... and his examples are still remembered AND relevant! Take a class with this guy and you will learn more than you know. Absolutely outstanding! Bright, articulate, witty and a reasonable person.... lots of laughs, too.

I had Dr. Roloff for several classes. I just couldn't get enough of this guy. He's brilliant, is a GREAT professor, teaches with an incredible clarity, and is basically fascinating. I'm serious -- I'd be a Roloff groupie if possible. EXCELLENT!!
Roloff rules! One of those professors every NU student should have at least once. Easy A.

I took 4-5 courses with this professor and recommend EVERY student at NWU take at least one of his courses. I've been out of school 7 years and still remember many concepts/theories because of his amazing lecture style.

Dr. Roloff is a wonderful professor and truly knows his stuff. I have learned so much from him throughout my years here at Northwestern. He's a great teacher and friend! I would highly recommend his classes!
Wonderful professor!!

1820259.name: Joshua Chambers-Letson
comments: take his class
Wonderful professor. Recommends his students to return books after reading when they buy it from amazon. He has no problem with underlining, marking books and returning them.

Josh is an amazing professor, engaging, funny, and really smart. He keeps class relevant and interesting. Willing to engage ideas contrary to his own. Willing to during office hours. Readings are super interesting. TAKE HIS CLASS.

162061.name: William Murphy
comments: Professor Murphy is one of the most inspirational and passionate people I have ever encountered. He inspires his students to care about the world and the material he teaches. He appreciates it when students invest time and effort into their papers. He is flexible on deadlines as long as you put effort and care into your assignments.
very helpful and sweet, appreciates the work and thought you put into class and papers, etc.
No Comments
No Comments
MURPHY IS AMAZING. WHAT A GREAT ACCENT.
Took him in summer school and enjoyed his class a lot. He made it informal and interesting and helped lead some nice discussions. And he's a sweetie pie.
No Comments

442062.name: M. Scott Curtis
comments: I really loved this class! Although his class was about four hours long I never got bored because of how passionately Curtis talks about his subject. He's very helpful when you ask for help, he's a fair grader and you can learn A LOT of useful information in his class! Looking forward to taking another class with him.
He's extremely passionate about his work. Funny and makes class more lively. If you do the work and follow up with everything, you'll do well. He's a fair grader.

curtis is awesome, he's so passionate about what he talks about and because of his passion he makes me and probably a lot of other students want to learn more, go to class, do the work, and plus he's funny and he makes analyzing film so enjoyable.
What a wonderful teacher. Knows SO MUCH about so SO MANY things that it's just a joy to have him teaching you his ways.

220 Is an enjoyable class overall, although your TA can make or break you. Mine killed me over the smallest things and was entirely unhelpful. Watch out for Margaret! Some of the movies are cool, others are boring, take it if you're a film major, not worth
No Comments
No Comments

One of greatest profs at NU. I miss Bordwell & Thompson. I was a lazy ass(regretfully)and did well and I'm no film analysis genius.The material is amazing and Curtis is awesome...it shows that he prepares really damn well for class...he memorized all our names in a class of 100!
Avoid 220 like the plague (unless you're RTVF and absolutely have to). Curtis instructs his TAs to fail a certain number of people per class. Don't say I didn't warn you...

289629.name: Tracy Davis
comments: Hardest class; mind-changing. Everything the other reviewer said is exactly right.

This woman is the most amazing teacher and mentor anyone could hope to have. Brilliant beyond imagining, fully committed to her work. Those who are easily daunted will probably find her classes to be the kind of thing you look back on and are grateful to have done once it's over, but for folks who really want to learn, there's nobody better!

1785780.name: Gunther Branham
comments: Super cool guy. I took him online for a IT Strategy class and thought his lectures were relevant based on his experience and the HW assignments were challenging yet if you put in the time, energy, thought you will be fine. I would for sure take his class again.

One of the most engaged Professors. He puts a lot of information into his lecture slides. Very engaged in the topic of IT strategy. The book material is dry. Plan on reading and writing a lot in this course. Also, the exams require you to attend the lectures and complete the assignments. Not much feedback on exams and papers.
I really enjoyed the class and the principles we discussed are very applicable to the IT industry. He's got great experience and has passion for the topic.
Pretty clear lecture and easy to understand... Submit Home works in time and you will be all right.

825570.name: Faisal Akkawi
comments: I wouldn't say he's hard, but he does challenge you, which is good as that is how you learn. Homework was especially challenging at times. Provides weekly lectures and if you follow them and take good notes, you'll do good. No surprises - final was similar to homework. Advice on final: speed is essential. Work fast or you won't finish in time.

I had a 98% entering the Final; which consisted of 4 problems. He awarded me a 50%, even though the answers were identical to previous work that had received a 98% . When I called him, he said that on the Final he "awarded 1/3 of the class a 100%, 1/3 a 75% and 1/3 a 50%." He threatened six of us with an F if we reported him to the administration.
Bad explainer and comes off as arrogant. Avoid if possible.

He doesn't give much feedback on your homework, so you have no idea what you did wrong. the assignments can be fun, only if you had prior dealings with networking. but if you haven't you might end up doing assignments for 7+ hours and looking up youtube tutorials for help, as he doesn't offer much. plus, they don't even help you study for the final

Homework assignments are graded lightly, so when you take the final which is much harder you will score low. He is difficult to get help from and the course concepts are more difficult to master than other classes. He only knows how to explain the concept one way, so if you do not follow you will need to figure it out on your own. Take alone.

The professor is also the Director of the program which makes me question whether or not I want to continue in the program. I have already told many of my co-workers to look elsewhere. The professor is not helpful, lectures are prerecorded, confusing and outdated. He doesn't offer weekly sync sessions. Overall he is kind of lazy.
Great teacher and communicator. He is always making sure students understand database software and design. Highly recommend Dr. Faisal Akkawi.

Dr. Akkawi is knowledgeable and his classes are very interesting. That said, there is generally lot of background work and reading if you want to make most out of the class and learn. But he manages to generate interest in the subject and is one of my best professors I came across.

Had him for Database Systems and Design. He's friendly and charismatic, but an awful teacher. Lectures were unorganized, the book was seldom referenced and of almost no help. Extremely frustrating class. I got an A, but learned little. Kind of terrifying that he's the director of the whole program at Northwestern.

He is a great speaker and always neat and groomed. He knows how to act in the front of class. But he is very average teacher. His class would be a good recap for people with database knowledge, but very complex for new students. He is the boss and can allow himself to be an average instructor in a school with a good name.
Great teacher, need to follow with classes, gives good directions for homework but you have to do it perfectly otherwise he takes off a lot of points for mistakes.

I don't know how this guy teaches at all- he has no teaching skills and his class is impossible to comprehend. I have spoken to many people in class, and everyone (including the people with the Database background) are frustrated with him. He needs to step down and hire a good teacher. I will avoid him from now on.
He is great and helpful. Easy to follow his explanation and he answers your questions
Dr. Akkawi is an excellent communicator, resourceful and knowledgeable beyond the information covered in his course.

This teacher is great, I noticed everyone who didn't think it was okay to take weeks off of school passed and everyone who thought it was okay to skip class didnt graduate the class. this professor is very well recognized as top notch
Worst class ever with this Prof! In my college, this class was my ONLY "C". No idea what the hell he was teaching. It's a waste of time sitting in his class.

He's funny and definately has a sense of humor. I didn't understand much of the class ( at RMU in Chicago). His exams are extremely hard and because he doesn't use the book there is very little to help with studying. He is extremely intellegent, but I wouldn't take his class again.
Perfect Faculty.
An excellent prof. He cares a lot about the students and you will learn about Database design and implementation.
terribly unorganized, lectures didn't make sense, wastes a lot of time answering silly questions

876233.name: Ithai Stern
comments: Professor Stern taught this class at INSEAD Singapore in November 2014. I took it there, and it was one of the best classes I have taken at INSEAD. I was just sorry that it was the last class I took because I just graduated so my mind was already elsewhere. I am glad though that it was my last experience at INSEAD. Highly recommended if he ever com
Outstanding! Updated examples with clear academic theory.
Best MORS course at Kellogg!
I took this class 2 years ago and found how much helpful it was only recently, as I am using the material to manage a change at my work place. I wish I could have taken it again!
Great teacher!
Best class I had at Kellogg!
No Comments

If you can get the slides, don't bother to show up -- he just reads from them. He plays favorites, which is even worse. Don't bother to meet with him to ask why -- he makes up a bunch of MORS-y crap. I learned very little in this class; it was all obvious. One of the worst classes I took at Kellogg -- take Power in Orgs with Weber instead.

1662169.name: Phillip Braun
comments: Excellent class, learned a lot more than I expected and enjoyed the process
Difficult but excellent class. I highly recommend Professor Braun
I enjoyed the class a lot. The professor was very clear and helpful.

I am taking Prof Braun's class now. Prof Braun really goes out of his way to help his students. He has really good lecture slides and is very motivated to help us learn. I am fortunate to have taken his class.
Best professor at Kellogg, I highly receommend
Great class

I am taking his Fin I currently on the Chicago campus. I really like the class and I am getting a lot our of it. Before this class I did not want to take it. Now, I am learning to like finance and I might even take Professor Braun's Fin II class this summer. Bottom line, Prof Braun is one of the best professors at Kellogg.
I am taking his Fin I class downtown. Fantastic class. He brings finance to life. Very dynamic. Fortunate I took his Fin I class.
Great class. Very difficult final. Very good teacher the. Best so far

Fin I with Braun is a very good class. The Prof is very available and helpful. He has great lecture notes and and a very intense lecture style, which makes the class very interesting. I am actually learning to like finance.

Fin I with Professor Braun was a very valuable learning experience. I am not a finance person but I realy learned to appreciate the topic with Professor Braun. I strongly recommend Professor Braun to all Kellogg students.
Turbo Finance was a great class with Braun. I strongly recommend students take the class with him.
Turbo Fin with Prof Braun is a great class. The class is very intense and so is the Prof. He really makes the material interesting to learn.
Best prfoessor I have had at Kellogg. Strongly recommend
Great Prof. Very helpful in and out of class. Great lecture notes.

804216.name: Will Reno
comments: Jointly taught a very cool class on Intervention, International Law and Human Rights which got me hooked on Africa in general and the subject in particular. He also guest lectured on Africa in another class. Take a class with him if you get a chance.
perfect if you like shorty shorts and big stashes...oh and the big guns.
No Comments
Sooo chill! Check out his facebook fan club group.

760709.name: Ed Malthouse
comments: He is a great professor who tries his hardest to impart learning, and make stats relevant to business and marketing. I will always owe any small amount of analytical foundation that I have to his class.
made me fall in love with stats
A good and decent man. Very helpful, genuinely interested in your success. If you work hard you will be rewarded. Numbers don't lie, after all.
Good guy, extremely helpful. His job is harder then ours, trust me.
No Comments
Very unnecessary course. Very unclear, would have liked to know what to do with data retrieved, instead of data retrieval.

Really nice guy--seems genuinely interested in teaching. I think he knows that most students are taking stats because they have to, not because they want to. He works hard to make it seem relevant to real business/marketing issues.

160049.name: Michael Bailey
comments: No chance to truly test if you understand the material, you find out with the final but then it is too late to try to fix what you don't truly know. Homeworks do not match what to expect from the final.
No Comments
One of the most interesting classes I took at NU.
No Comments

Love him or hate him, Bailey is a good scientist, and he's not afraid to take a stance based on research rather than politics. Even though I found some of his attitudes...surprising, he based them in well designed research. And he's a heck of a nice guy. He does sometimes throw some tricky wording into his test questions, through. Watch out.
Mike is fun and quite interestesting, take his class
He's not a bad guy, don't believe the hype. He takes the time to make sure his students learn.
Bailey really sucks....his research is biased and not conducted correctly, yet he makes assumptions that would imply he has a large n and no biases....really terrible prof. Don't take his class!!!!!
Hated being a lab rat for the department as part of the introduction to psych class. Found it unethical.

Professor Bailey explained the content of the mateiral clearly and had his best interet in all students to benefit from the class. It involves hard work, reading textbook and showing up to class daily. His class is interesting and at the same time can be fun learning new mateiral. It's a fun experie
A horrible, unethical teacher. It's a shame he's so popular...but when you have incredibly easy to cheat on tests, then that is no surprise.
cool guy
sux
Bailey is a fantastic prof. His class is enjoyable and he's always willing to meet outside of class time to help.
Plays favorites big time. Pushes his own research and doesn't answer questions satisfactorily.
Not a decent person outside the classroom.
not fun at all.
No Comments
No Comments
Good times, entertaining & you learn a lot. I dig Bailey.

1533937.name: Steven Andes
comments: I don't think he has a very good reputation. Plus, whatever he teaches has no bearing in real life. Why would rich people interact with poor people?
If you look at where your professors have taught, if it's multiple locations, it should tell you something...
Took his course at NU----really bad at teaching, I mean how do you teach someone EXCEL???

556473.name: Albert Hunter
comments: Prof Hunter is an awesome teacher. You will learn so much in his class, he is understanding, caring, and fun to be around. Great teacher, great lectures, his is very very knowledgeable. You won't regret taking his class. He is wonderful
Great Sociology teacher! Best at Northwestern. Hunter is the best
One of the best profs. Really good...

556470.name: Gary Alan Fine
comments: My fave.
Agreed -- a bitter man whose obvious brilliance is overshadowed by his even more obvious hatred of people.
bitter man. i asked for advice and he was just bitter for no reason. i am happy i don't have to take his classes anymore.

162268.name: Jeff Rice
comments: Prof. Rice can be disorganized and sometimes goes off on different topics, but he is a great teacher and accessible to his students. Homework is fair- neither too hard or easy. He likes to analyze topics through political philosophies.

I had Dr Rice for five classes at NU. He brings a lot of passion to teaching and always keeps it fresh. He's pretty flexible if you have an issue and super accessible. I also had him as one of three advisers on an independent study project in my last quarter. His help here set me up for grad school.
Great class learned a bunch

He can be hard to follow at times, hes big into interpreting history through philosophy. If you don't know philosophy, you could be a bit lost at first. Keep up with the reading and its easier to understand where he's coming from.
Awesome professor. Best at Northwestern.
Great Class, I had a lot of interest. Not real clear on finals and midterms. In the end because of his lack of clarity, cost me a good grade in his class, a C.
I love prof rice and you will too. he's great. not hot but extremely interesting.

130978.name: Robert Hasty
comments: Picks great rep
Does his job well.
nice guy. a little on the boring side.
He's so sexy.

1149888.name: Shelby Hatch
comments: My absolute favorite. She is so intelligent, kind, and inspiring.

Dr Hatch is great! Unfortunately, you will be dealing with TAs most of the time and she doesn't always pick good TAs. She is available outside of class though, which is super helpful. Labs are a time suck, but the experiments are pretty interesting.
unprepared for class, disorganized, doesn't know how to teach

158906.name: Charles Moskos
comments: One of the few classes I still think about at Northwestern!

Definitely doesn't life up to the hype. For an Intro to Sociology class, there was far too much emphasis on the military and failure to emphasis important sociological theories. Also, he told **** jokes on several occasions and one week he told Mexican jokes that were so offensive, the next week he publicly apologized to the class.

i had him in 1990 - fall of freshman year - and still remember that it was one of my favorite classes in undergrad, particularly for a massively large intro class. he made it so interesting - great lecturer.

One of the few classes that I actually looked forward to. He is a very prominent prof that specializes in military sociology, and is often criticized or praised for coming up with the "don't ask, don't tell" policy on gays in the military.

man, this guy is ridiculous. I found some of his views on gay folks (especially his belief that they should be barred form the military) offensive and off-putting. It made his other points less credible. he also is not an especially talented lecturer. skip him.
Took this class because I heard he was going to retire soon, and that he was an interesting lecturer. I was a lil' disappointed, but it's probably because I don't like sociology (not Moskos)
can be arrogant and very closed-minded, very vocal against ****s in the military
He is really entertaining. He brings soc out of the cut and dry material that it is, and relates it to class with polls and editorials. Definately take soc with Moskos!
Overrated but a good class
Class is like watching a movie. Watch for his random references to his friends Ralph Nadar and George Stephanopolus

Fun, interesting, entertaining lectures where you learn a lot. He's one of the best and it's sad to see him go. His favoritism of certain students, displays of arrogance (whoopty doo Princeton) and name dropping (yay Clinton) caused a couple eyes to roll.

Very informative prof. Easy to understand because he speaks like a normal human being, which is why some may call mistakenly call him easy . Super Nice guy. Has students over his house for dinner occasionally. Studies military, doesn't love it.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

888911.name: Larry Trzupek
comments: Fantastic professor to learn organic chemistry from! Organized, funny, and extremely helpful outside of class. Trzupek writes some seriously hard exams but the foundation for orgo that you get from making it through his class is priceless. He prepares you for the whole sequence phenomenally well!
Trzupek is a great lecturer and a patient, helpful teacher. Go to his group help sessions or office hours if you have questions. The only downside is that Trzupek's tests are difficult.
Lawrence is a gr9 teacher get it like gr8 but with a 9 hahaha but really Lawrence is the man you go Lawrence
Larry's the best! I loved his humor and his genuine willingness to help. He's one of my favorite profs at NU, but one of my least fav testers. All in all I'd take his class again.

Dr. Trzupek is AWESOME! Orgo is a really tough class, and his exams are hard, but he is always willing to help and is probably as clear as it gets when explaining chemistry. Wouldn't want to take the class with anybody else!
The best teacher ever! He is super organized, fun, nice, and funny. I would never want to take orgo with any other professor
No Comments

OK, I figured I'd post my review here since Trzupek has left Furman to go back to Chicago.... that won't change his teaching. Thoroughly organized, clear lecturer who very clearly knows his stuff. Tests are hard, but fair, and doable if you've reviewed your notes. Watch out for flying chalk. You gained a great prof when he left us at Furman.

178801.name: Nancy Whitaker
comments: She's at UW Parkside now. Amazing teacher, really. I'm not a music major, but she helped me re-discover my love of music, and we didn't once listen to something I'd consider 'up-my-lane-music'. If you have a chance. Take her class.
She was my favorite prof in my 4 years at NU. She genuinely cared for her students. NU treated her badly and lost a great professor :(
Whitaker is amazing. She was an advocate for all of the music ed kids, and now look. NU, your music ed program is going down the toilet...please please please fix it
Great teacher!! She always went extra miles to help her students. Too bad that she has left. What a big loss for Northwestern.

1882295.name: Mohyeddin Kassar
comments: Super hard, no extra credit, doesn't follow the syllabus !! DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS
No extra credit, final is super hard. Must buy and read the book, his lectures are confusing and not based on the book. He yelled at me for being 5 minutes late, infront of the class.
Hard on grading, VERY BORING. Better off with a different instructor. He doesn't have his masters yet!
You are better off reading the book by yourself. This professor will confuse you instead of teaching. You have been warned.
DOnt ever take his class.. you will regret it
Worst teacher ever! makes fun of you. have no respect for others. dont care about helping you , tries to be funny. No one in the class likes him

1580280.name: Douglas Foster
comments: Take a class with Foster. He's an absolute media guru who understands the concept of getting pieces published. If you can't handle Foster's advice, you won't survive in the professional world.

I STRONGLY CAUTION YOU AGAINST TAKING A CLASS WITH THIS MAN. I, personally, found him so condescending that I was not able to work effectively in his course. He gave off some very weird vibes and discounted everything I tried to say about my own writing and learning processes. Not an experience I wanted in grad school. STAY AWAY.

771881.name: Martin Block
comments: No Comments
so awesome

1784356.name: Mark Clare
comments: Embodies the academic spirit, fair course administration, encourages open and respectful dialogue on relevant topics.
Lenient. Fun. Wise. Informative.

A brilliant instructor; works really hard and reads all papers and comments on them. I loved the class, although I think that online class involved too much work - I think that home works should be around 30% shorter. If you like writing - you will benefit form this class; but be prepared to work really hard!

520876.name: Gueorgui Derluguian
comments: I took Dr Derlugian's Organized Crime class in the Summer quarter. Normally, his classes are a mob scene with everyone trying to get in. My class had one other NU student. Everyone else was Stanford or Ivy and had heard about the class. It was easily my favorite class at NU. Georgi is tops!
Fantastic professor; knows the material like the back of his hand.

Brilliant guy. Hang on 'cause you're in for a ride and he's not slowing down for anything. Surprisingly not too hard, although he's so much smarter than everyone else he probably thinks you're an idiot. No big deal -- you definitely don't want to miss taking a class from him! Prepare to do some work and you'll be just fine.
From three-toed horses to 3000 AD, how does he tie it all together so well?
What a riot. A bit disjointed, and a little intimidating as a freshman, but good overall.
This man rox my sox. Most brilliant prof I have yet to discover. Take him any chance you get.
Best prof. EVER. Derluguian is one of the most fascinating people I've ever had the pleasure of learning from.

1936474.name: Lorena Martin
comments: Dr. Martin was interesting in her sync sessions and the material was factual and current.

Great course/professor and very relevant whether you are looking to work in the sports field or are a sports fan. Dr. Martin's expertise in Exercise Physiology defined the early part of the course and her statistical background was evident once we started working in R. I highly recommend Dr. Martin.

Dr Martin is truly an amazing instructor. She is a great communicator and is always willing to help and clarify questions on the course. She always returned emails in a timely fashion and her class is very organized. The class itself is great, there is a lot of reading and even more work to be done with R Programming.

This was the first time this course was being taught & I think some of the kinks were still being worked out. However, Dr. Martin has extensive knowledge of analytics, sports/sports analytics, and physiology/kinesiology. Very interesting stuff, but also felt like a lot to absorb in 10 weeks.

Dr. Martin is thorough in her lessons, assignments, test and works really well with the students. She is very understanding of the students concerns and pushes them to excel at every step of the way. Dr. Martin has been very responsive to all the students in regards to their questions and assignments. I am glad to be a student in her class.

Great instructor. Her discussion topics were really great and they helped us to understand the subject better. Other than that, just one non-positive feedback is that I felt like she did not involve in class discussions often.
Great professor. Dr. Martin was very helpful when it came to providing guidance on assignments. She responded to e-mails quickly and her explanations always made sense.
Dr. Martin has been great and very helpful. The topic for discussion are important to the class understanding. The tests are manageable in the week. The project is also manageable with practice in R.
discussions relevant -- the schear nature of R is difficult to teach in an online environment but I feel we're set up to succeed -- we'll see on the grading, but seems to be fair.
Great experience with this professor!
Great Professor. Responds to emails within 24 hours. Actively participates in the discussion boards.
Very detailed regarding what is expected on assignments.
Great stats professor!
Awesome Instructor at Northwestern University!
Makes intro to stats understandable!

1756068.name: Karl T Muth
comments: This professor's logic and arguments are atrocious. He cites facts that are easily proven misinterpreted, misunderstood or seemingly fabricated.
He's smart and cares about his students. I think every econ student should take this class.
Great professor. I expected this class to be sort of boring but he kept it interesting.
Awesome instructor, very helpful, willing to answer any and all questions, very accessible outside of class, willing to help connect you to possible job opportunities through his connections

999622.name: Elzbieta Foeller-Pituch
comments: Often seemed flustered and unprepared for class. Asked very leading questions which made discussion awkward and forced. She also assumed students knew a great deal of historical knowledge. Also not afraid to call students out in class / embarrass them into participation. Not a great classroom atmosphere

Take a class with her and get ready for interminable blathering. She doesn't put as much thought or work into class but expects a lot from her students. She doesn't return ANYTHING so you're left in the dark about where you stand. Worthless professor. Avoid!!!

1649670.name: Erich Spengler
comments: Great instructor, had great knowledge and would stir intrest in you as a student. Great communication skills and assignments are very well thought out. Other CIS instructors do not know how to teach or are very dry.
Great instructor! Many Information Systems instructors at Northwestern are terrible, Erich is an exception.
Good teacher; recommend! you will enjoy learning without stress.
Great professor. Easy on the HW and great on clarity. Recommended!

2522196.name: Greg Miller
comments: very frustrating prof. the class guidelines are not clear and you are graded based on only a few assignments. refused to meet outside of class, making students walk all the way across town if they wanted to get any face time. don't take his courses! find a better prof in psych who does real health work like Chen or real quant work like Revelle

worst prof I've had in my graduate career. as a grad student you expect some amount of intellectual curiosity from your professors, but prof miller is only interested in his narrow area of research, talking down other areas as inferior. It got to be quite insulting at times, especially since I'm not a psychologist. I do not recommend his courses.

Professor Miller was fine I guess? but this was my least favorite psych class I've taken in my undergraduate career at Northwestern. expectations unclear, he only cares about his own research areas and shows clear disinterest in other areas beyond biological psychology. didn't get the sense that he was too intellectually curious beyond his niche

Not clear on his expectations for the course. also seemed to care a lot about his one particular area of study, but didn't give any thought to others. this impacted grading, so be sure to say what he wants you to say in your final paper! Just parrot it back without thinking and he will be happy
Not a hard grader, but not interested in teaching. I didn't get the sense that he cared about his students :/

159980.name: Michael Peshkin
comments: Here's the thing: if he's your teacher for 233 the class is hard because it's hard material and it's a lot of people's first time learning it-Peshkin is sometimes abrupt and intimidating but at the end of the day you can tell he really cares about us learning!!

Professor Peshkin might seem indifferent or annoyed, but he really does care about his students. He wants people to learn and his strategy involves a lot of work on the student's end. This was my second class with him, and knowing that he expects students to be independent and learn by doing really helps.
Disturbing
Course requirements are demanding, and Professor's personality initially seems abrupt or impatient, but classroom instruction is excellent and I learned a lot.
No Comments
No Comments
Sucko
PESHKIN IS A TROLL
No Comments
No Comments
BOOOOOO!
No Comments

158735.name: Wendi Gardner
comments: Dr. Gardner is not interested in helping you learn, but rather more into herself. If youre an original thinker, Id avoid this class, she will put you down, as well as your GPA. She put very little effort into lectures, the material was all over the place, and was not helpful inside the class nor accessible out. Totally overrated. Worst professor.
Listen/take notes in lecture
She's very cute and a major chain smoker - I see her outside smoking 24/7
she's an amazing psychologist and social scientist! So friendly and incredibly smart! Take her classes and do research with her!!
she rocks
Cute, in a mousy kinda way...
No Comments
impossible tests, but pretty cute
boring ppt.
Very cute.
Soo sweet!
No Comments
extraordinarily hot
so hot!!!!
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

526196.name: Aryeh Routtenberg
comments: Not a very helpful professor with hard exams in store.
No Comments
Self-important windbag.
No Comments

2020890.name: Michael Mulcahy
comments: Considering he is an active performer, his record as a teacher is mind blowing. Former students playing in the Berlin Philharmonic, San Francisco Symphony, Boston Symphony, and countless positions in academia. If you are driven, he will work you very hard, but you will come out of it a solid musician.

I paid $45000 a year tuition to attend Northwestern to study with Professor Mulcahy and he missed 60% of the academic year. He was away doing other projects. He started teaching to get his hours in before the year had begun and before I arrived in Evanston. I got a lesson with him 2x a quarter (which was not what he promised when I applied).
Wow! He goes on vacation for 4.5 weeks in the middle of a 10 week quarter. Then wants to give make-up lessons over thanksgiving break when everyone has arranged to travel home.

I partially agree with previous comments: sarcastic - yes; hilarious - not if it's directed towards you! Inspirational - when he's not too busy badmouthing other trombone players. The bone studio at NU is simply too big. Very little chance for individual attention. Mulcahy stops any honest feedback with intimidation.
Hilarious, sarcastic and inspirational.

It is great to hear Professor Mulcahy play in the CSO every week, but that is where his interest lies. His teaching is second to his playing and you feel that as a student. You get about 2 lessons a quarter with him. For the cost of tuition, I wanted more help.

Professor MULCAHY is a great trombone player. However, in my lessons he would often speak in disparaging terms about his colleagues in the CSO. You get a lesson with him about every 5 weeks and sometimes he seems more interested in sending texts on his phone than teaching. Studio class can be variable. Inspiring one week, distracted the next.

After auditioning and being accepted to the NU trombone studio, I was excited to study with Professor Mulcahy. However, in my 2 year Graduate degree, I had surprisingly few actual lessons with him (even though he assured me at the audition that I would get one about every 2 weeks). I had more lessons in 1 semester in my undergrad than in 2 years NU

2160548.name: She-e Wu
comments: High schoolers reading comments to determine where to audition/enroll - really consider what you want out of a program. This is a classical, orchestral program with few outside gigs/time/anything unrelated to music. Similar to Peabody in my opinion. Know that you will work hard and experience very little at NU, which still gives you a good music ed

Her job is to make you a better musician, so she's tough. Culturally she's not into pats on the back. Know that going in. Outside of class she's an incredibly nice human being. The cons are that she has a lot going on outside of NU, so she's gone/busy a lot. Studying with her allows for no outside activities. Little empathy for other interests.

Great musician & businessperson. Generally a nice person. Perfect for grad students. Lack of organizational skills/ability to plan have negative impact on undergrads who have to take non-music classes too. Don't count on being able to work, socialize, travel or participate in Greek life/clubs. Need to be very flexible with your time to study w/her.

I agree with first poster. Prof Wu doesn't provide positive feedback, but she's an excellent percussionist. There's never a "good enough," which makes for excellent musicians. The problem at the university level is that she does not allow for any electives, evening/weekend plans, university activities/clubs, travel, double majoring or employment.

Great percussionist with limited teaching ability or planning skills. No encouragement, only criticism. Additional rehearsals scheduled weekdays/nights (ending 12 am or later), most weekends & some holidays. Very little notice is given of scheduling, but you're expected to attend even if you have other classes or outside conflicts including a job.

791233.name: Kayed Akkawi
comments: It doesn't matter how smart the Professor is if he/she can't properly teach in a comprehensive manner. This person does not appear to truly grasp the fact that majority of the students never did programming. He teaches as if people do have experience. He needs to learn how to teach more than anything else. Terrible person to learn from.

Well, if you have never taken a programming class, you will struggle-struggle the whole quarter! Class covers lots of programming techniques and does not go deep into details (read the book.) For me, it felt like a good class to recap my existing knowledge.
This guy is useless
He is very decoted to students.
The class was useful for me. He answered all the questions I had. I had a lot.
Teaches directly from the book. Doesn't create own lecture note, uses presentations created by book authors. Not a good teacher for beginners.

828164.name: Mohammad Abdeljaber
comments: Best teacher to take!
Rude at times. Unclear. Thick accent makes it hard to understand his english.
Mohammad is really great. He sincerely wants his students to learn and apply the material.
Intense class, but a fun, patient and understanding professor.
He was great!
Mohammad is so cute. and he's a fabulous teacher. the best of both worlds. Definitely makes nine o'clock class worth it.
No Comments

959185.name: Rick Morris
comments: Rick Morris is not a good instructor.
No Comments

163136.name: Charles Whitaker
comments: Outstanding professor! Really takes time to understand his students and nurture them. Gives great advice and very helpful in career as a student and a professional. He is one of the true gems of Northwestern!

i had him in 1993 or 1994, and i still remember him. his class was fun. i remember that he really knew his stuff, but above all, he is super nice and - shockingly - remembered me years later at a reunion.
Whitaker is the best teacher I've ever had. On top of that, what a handsome guy. He has the most beautiful hands I've ever seen!

494427.name: Paul Arntson
comments: Outstanding instructor who really cares about what he teaches. He is passioniate about the subject matter and it shows. Anyone looking to add to their leadership toolbox needs to take this course with him. His lack of organization is a trademark but not a deterent.

This rating system does not ask the most important questions. Did I learn something in this class? YES - a great deal. However, I had to learn it myself, with the support of other students. the instructor laid the groundwork, but expected students to take it from there. Arnston's heart is in the right place and the course matters a great deal.

Dr. Arntson is a strong advocate for the disenfranchised. He gives students the necessary information and expects us to process it, in its complexity, and work with each other to make sense of it. The classes he teaches are not difficult, but leave students with a greater sense of understanding. He is difficult to find for help however.

159484.name: Lane Fenrich
comments: Generally a good professor

I had heard some good things and some bad things about the class so I decided to give it a shot. The material was interesting but the discussions lacked any guidance. Overall I felt like Prof. Fenrich was more interested in being the "cool guy" than teaching the class.

Fantastic prof...great sense of humor and expectations are clear and managable. I would highly recommend taking any of his classes. Who could dislike a prof who likes to end the semester over drinks? Loved him!
Fantastic prof........funny, intelligent. I would highly recommend him.

It's been almost 5 years since i took a course from fenrich but i still remember him. took a total of 3 classes from him - he makes history fresh/relevant. you will work but you will learn. totally objective in grading. LOVE the films. he's responsible for introducing NU kids to dr. strangelove!

Among the Top 10 Classes you have to take at NU. And with this prof! Prof. Fenrich is by far the best professor at NU. The workload is considerable, but the knowledge and experience with him is well worth it.

He's just a whole lotta fun. My friend and I got front row seats for most of his lectures. Love his lecturing style, enthusiasm, and his incorporation of relevant flicks to help us understand the times. Plus he's just a doll!
No Comments

You will work for him but you will find it rewarding. Excellent at leading thoughtful discussions without injecting his opinions into them (as many profs do). You will not be afraid to express your views in his class. Purely objective grader.
No Comments
No Comments
Fenrich is one of the best profs at NU.

1784338.name: Ken W Woo
comments: Dr. Woo is an excellent lecturer, he is clear in his instructions for assignments and is a fair grader. Real world case studies are what I am interested in and Dr. Woo delivers these. Some of the discussions really made me think about my organization processes. The guest speakers were excellent.

Dr. Woo was understanding and considerate. He was generally very positive. The course did seem more catered to a business-like perspective and as the other comment said, it may not be optimal for a rigorous understanding of networking.

As a working professional, I appreciated that Dr. Woo valued our time. He presented useful material in an interesting and challenging manner. He encouraged further research, but did not make the class unnecessarily cumbersome. He was accessible and prompt in returning voice and emails. The material presented was informative and practical.

If u want 2 learn networking -avoid! Subject taught like a business college class - write papers 'why is networking important' If u write technical paper he literally said "this paper is to technical." If u want 2 pass without sweat, just write some BS and submit it in time. Northwestern really degraded. This guy is a director and does not care

280903.name: Tom Meade
comments: Meade does not care at all about his students. He's too busy to answer e-mails or teach you anything. He's a cranky old man who tries to crack jokes during lectures, and goes TURBOSPEED in lectures. He's not a nice guy in 1 on 1 settings either, and makes you feel dumb if you don't get something after 1 second.
Tom Meade is a great professor.
He's really nice, and the class is really easy

652574.name: Sonbinh Nguyen
comments: One of the best chemistry teachers at Northwestern, totally worth waking up early morning for his lectures.
No Comments
No Comments
Favorite prof ever

165625.name: Martin Redish
comments: The best teacher, for one of the most dreaded courses in law school. Take this guy if you can.
Funny, helpful, brilliant, great speaker. He's not only one of the foremost academics in the classes he teaches, he is also quite talented at doing exactly that - teaching.
Great teacher, brilliant guy. Some people think he borders on egotistical. I didn't find this to be the case, and even if it was his ability easily makes up for it.

After first semester, do not waste your time with his classes if you only want to learn the "blackletter" basics. His classes are valuable in that they take the law and place it in a theoretical context which is holistic yet nuanced. Great if you're into the "theory" of law.
Best teacher I have ever had.
No Comments

150752.name: Peter Hayes
comments: I liked the class, but it isnt that end all be all of acadameia-It is weird that everyone thinks he is the messiah of history when all that he lectures on are things that can be gleaned from any history book on the Holocaust
The best lecturer I've ever heard. Absolutely wonderful.
AMAZING LECTURES! Bring popcorn, his lectures are better than a movie. All I can say is amazing!
Every lecture is a rewarding experience, both for your mind and for your eyes.
Peter Hayes is awesome. Some poeple think that he's pompous, but it's just that they aren't smart enough to see how brilliant he is.
No Comments
No Comments

He's very smart and he knows it which can make him come off as arrogrant. But I would never miss one of his lectures. One of the few who can make lectures exciting - usually wrapping them around some moral lesson. You will work for him, but worth it.
Beautiful eyes!
No Comments
Very dynamic and extremely knowledgeable

827841.name: Eric Schulz
comments: A lot of people like him because he is amusing, and its true that he's one of the funniest proffessors I've ever had. But the class is based only on difficult exams. If you want to do well, study, go to lectures, go to the office hours he has before exams, go to discussion, do the reccomended psets, and read/reread the texts
I love eric !!!
ERIC IS THE MAN!!

Schulz is STRONGLY and grossly overrated as a prof. Sure he cracks a joke every now and then, but he lectures at a nearly incomprehensible speed and his exams are ridiculously pointless and hard...when the man has multiple choice questions each worth 8% which are based on a random sentence from the text, that's in no way helpful.
No Comments
microeconomics

1873113.name: Owen P Priest
comments: Horrible professor, completely self-absorbed and creepy. Will never take a class with him again. I ended up teaching myself and passed the class with an A. Save yourself the money and headache. I though this school was top-notch. This man hardly understands chemistry.
Dr. Priest was an amazing professor for orgo. Take him if you want a deep, complete understanding of organic chemistry. Don't take him if you want a good grade!
His lectures are truly amazing. You will learn a lot and possibly suffer a lot.
Dr. Priest's class is rough but worth it. Prepares you for pre-medpre-healthlife like no other.
Brutal.
The best!
OPP rocks! Makes orgo fun

638445.name: Mark Sheldon
comments: Great professor! keeps class entertained and focused. Great Bioethics class! one of my favorites
No Comments
No Comments

963121.name: Sorin Maruster
comments: One of the best professors at Kellogg
I have taken him for 3 classes - Best teacher I have ever had. Northwestern is lucky to have him.
I wish he taught all of my classes for the rest of my life
I have taken 3 courses with Sorin. 20 years of education and Sorin is #1 on my list!!
I cannot believe Sorin isn't on here yet! Simply the best guy ever. Very thorough notes, extremely helpful, interested in the material. All-around fabulous guy.

867673.name: Erinn Mee
comments: I like live action role playing as much as the next guy. So when I heard that Dr. Mee was into that, I was totally pumped to attend her class. I love plushies but I'm not really sure why I paid for bio class though. I didn't learn anything about Biology. Her final exam was a mystery to me. I feel like I got bandersnatched by a jabberwokkee.

Quite possibly the worst teacher I have ever had. Her class is worthless and condescending. In class, she states her concern about us doing fractions alone but then the 4 HR EXAM has 400-level type questions entangled in her LARP scenarios. Also, unreliable. Esp at creating answer keys. Save your passion for bio and your GPA! Don't take this class!

Pretty durn swell. Not only did she provide a comprehensive and comprehensible intro to biology, she made it interesting and challenging enough to keep pre-meds engaged. And this is the first time she's taught it!

159609.name: Ian Hurd
comments: Great guy, brought us donuts on the last day
hurd is one hot canadian
Hurd blows
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

1784328.name: Atef Bader
comments: Great hands-on class technical course Very knowledgeable in subject matter Mid-term and final are a lot of work Fair grader Helpful and accommodating regarding assignments

Challenging material, but Dr. Bader was very clear in his lectures, sync sessions and other communications. Keep up with the readings, practice the exercises from the text, and reach out to him and peers if needed. If I could do well in this class with ZERO prior knowledge of database systems, anyone can.

Very helpful professor. Knows what he's talking about and always willing to help you via supplemental tutorials and presentations. Ask for help and direction - you'll get it. Make sure you read the assigned text and complete exercises. Overall fun, informative class. Didn't struggle. But didn't slack on reading and work either.

192784.name: Jillana Enteen
comments: It was okay if you did your weekly facebook posts and kept up on readings. Def learned a lot and recommend this class!
Great prof. Can't recommend her highly enough.

Prof Enteen was the highlight of my class schedule. She assigns a midterm essay (5-7pages) and a final research paper (10-12 pages) and you must contribute weekly to online postings through facebook. I never thought I'd rethink my notions of Gender and Sexuality within the context of the Asian Diaspora. Definitely take her for any classes.
She gets you thinking in different ways. It's well worth taking any of her classes.
learned a ton, worked a lot, and she definitely changed my thinking!
there are better profs to take this class with.
Enteen is a stellar prof. Take anything she teaches.
Enteen is AWESOME!
Definitely deserving of her chilli pepper status.
Enteen is incredible!
Jillana's the best! And yes, she is quite attractive.
No Comments

919490.name: Katie Duke
comments: Katie was a tough teacher but if you were willing to do the work and put in the effort, she will do whatever it takes to help you achieve an "A". She takes class seriously and gives a lot back in terms of real life examples and professionalism. I learned so much from class - I would definately attend another one of her classes in the future.

Strict and sometimes pedantic, but she knows her stuff. If you are planning on not turning in essays or not showing up/showing up late to class you will not like her. Otherwise, she is very passionate and knowledgeable about the English language and a good professor.
Teacher has no heart. She sucks.

992461.name: Jerry Lassa
comments: If you're a non-math major that needs a stats credit, take Jerry's class. He's awesome.
HOT HOT HOT HOT HOT HOT HOT HOT. Can't believe he is over 40!

He is the nicest guy and very knowledgeable abougt statistics. The professor always responds to phone calls and emails in a timely manner. I would definitely take another course with him. He is the hottest professor that I ever had. I was not that interested in stats and was forced to take it. But I went to all his classes because he was hot.
Total geek, but whatta babe

1524005.name: Dennis Cao
comments: Dennis is the absolute best. Straightforward class, well-divided between lecture and interactive examples. He embodies "chill:" never seen him not calm, cool, and helpful, and he turns mistakes into constructive lessons. This man loves Organic Chem, but understands that you don't. Never condescending. love him, you will too. brilliant and hot.

she's horrible person and not really a good professor. Although she thinks she's greater than she really is, don't be fooled by her pretense...Her class is like listening to her text book she writes same things over and over again.

I loved her!
Awesome!

everything she says makes perfect sense.

She never returns emails or work. Told me not to worry. I aced the final, got a B+. She dropped me a letter grade for being late to 3 classes. C+ overall

159835.name: Edward Gibson

this guy's amazing. take his class

Awesome Professor-very Interesting and fun!

comments: Reading & Writing Creative Nonfiction. The material was interesting sometimes, but impossible to get her to answer questions or give any advice. She also assigned her own husband's videos way too much. I would have liked to read some traditional non-fiction.

I often felt in class that Ms. Biss wished she was anywhere but with us. She spent most of her time talking about herself or talking badly about other writers. I learned nothing and got the least feedback from her than from any other writing class.

She spent the majority of the semester talking about herself while badmouthing pretty much every other writer in the department. I felt dirty after every class with her. She also will make big claims about meeting with you outside of class but never EVER makes herself available.

430533.name: Galen Bodenhausen

Really liked this Prof. Clear teaching style, interesting class (special topics - social psych)

Honestly the most caring teacher I have ever met!
Great teacher!

worst class ever. DO NOT TAKE IT WITH HIM! You will not learn anything!

he's soooooo fantastic
awesome prof!!!!!!!!!

158883.name: Mark Witte
comments: He's awesome, if you're interested in learning. if you want to just take a class dont sign up. Go to class and do your work. You will do well. If not you will get a bad grade.

Absolutely hilarious. By far one of the best professors at CofC. Passionate about his work. Test difficulty is somewhere between ECON 200/201 tests and ECON 317/318 tests. Assigns multiple-choice homework before exams to help you review. TAKE HIM.

great to be around.
best prof i ever had

Mark Witte is the best here at NU, it's a shame not to take the course with him if you want to major in econ.
The guy dressed up as Bevis for Halloween the year I had him. How can you not love that? If you can do math and do the reading, you can get an A in his class.
Mark Witte is the bestest Mark Witte EVAR. Making econ interesting is possible, and Prof Witte did it!

Prof. Witte remembered me like 3 years after I took his class. I swear if I walked up to him tomorrow, he'd remember me. I was glad to see he is still at NU. I don't know about the Hot/Not thing but I'll give him the benefit of the doubt.
tests are completely devoid of lecture or reading material. Applied mean has no bearing whatsoever to the grades people recieved. A standard deviation of SEVENTEEN and the mean is 70.

Blah

2023075.name: Derek Nelson
comments: The best professor I have ever had - clear, direct, wildly knowledgable. He is helpful in and out of the classroom, and never failed to clearly communicate an idea. Love this guy

(I'm an SPS student so YMMV if you're undergrad) Good lecturer although the class is brutally fast, but not his fault he has to get through so much content in a short time. Challenging and tricky daily quizzes - do the HW and GO TO OFFICE HOURS & you should be okay. Generous curves. Solid guy. IDK about the hot pepper though. YMMV.

Treats most questions as an inconvenience to his poorly conceived lectures, does not probe for understanding. Examples given in practice quizzes and exams often contain erroneous answers that confuse many students, and are often the sort of unfair gotcha exam questions that seem to have more relevance in establishing arrogant superiority.
Nelson is great! Wish he taught orgo as well. Clear lectures. Tests are aligned with topics covered in class; no surprises on exams. Super approachable. Thumbs up!
Took the entire sequence with Professor Nelson. Very happy with my knowledge. Lectures are perfectly structured.
Class was hard, requires a lot of time to understand material. Lectures are very well organized and professor is great at explaining
Class is hard, but worth it! Derek Nelson is the best
Dr Nelson is the bomb. He made organic chemistry lab a party every single week

1026793.name: H. David Smith
comments: Professor Smith was an inspirational professor that took time to be thoughtful when assigning work and always cared about his students. No Comments
extremely cool!

Great professor- loves what he's doing and tries to help in any way possible
Rivers is the cutest science professor EVA
he's so cute and sweet. available a lot to help. but his final was a bit extreme.
hotttttttttttttttt

117690.name: Barry Coddens
comments: Have heard the other orgo profs are better. I would avoid him and take the others if you get the chance. Too much ego.
He sometimes teaches rather quickly so i found it helpful to red teh book. I would recommend reading ahead because the quizes he gives are pretty tough.

One of the best science courses I have ever taken. Coddens can be intimidating, but he means well and makes himself available outside of class. You definitely have to stay on top of the material or this class will seem harder than it is. I couldn't imagine learning organic chemistry from any other professor.

He's really tough, without knowing him well, you would think his midterms are WTF-ly unpredictable. BUT, he's really willing to help his students and do not give you the COLD stare if you start talking to him. He's awesome, I swear, take orgo with him and you feel like you are genius when you get out of his class throughout the year.
Coddens is a tough professor, but if you take the time to see him during office hours, he is very nice and helpful. Approaching him aggressively will not work in your favor.
Unhelpful. Rude. I feel sorry for him. It's such a shame when students really want to learn and he turns his back on cultivating "our future".

DO NOT TAKE CODDENS EVER!!! His test are unbelievable. Not sure why he is a professor at Northwestern. He was so rude that I cried several times in his office because of his insults. This man has no business being a teacher, he doesn't care about his students. As long as Coddens is still a professor, I will not donate a dime to the university.
Best. Teacher. EVAH!
Makes the material hard for the sake of being hard. Horrible teacher. Unwilling to help students. take anyone but him!!
just terrible

Dr. Coddens is absolutely the WORST professor I have ever had. Avoid at all costs. He is rude, disrespectful, and unhelpful. He does not care about his students success in his course or in life. He is constantly degrading students for not knowing the answers to questions. If you go to his office hours, he acts like you are wasting his time. BAD
Inexplicably difficult tests

Dr. Coddens doesn't really care if you understand orgo or not, he just likes to prove how much he really knows. He is absolutely terrible and what's worse, he is the Dean of the Department of Chemistry!
Dude acts like he will help you but will SCREW YOU.
No Comments

Dr. Coddens is a fantastic professor -- if you take the time to get to know him. Once the students not really committed to the class are weeded out, he takes a genuine interest in the remaining students. Go to his office hours -- it is absolutely worth it

He will be INCREDIBLY tough, but you will learn the material. If you're pre-med you'll be glad you went through this class. He teaches the toughest stuff and lets you learn from the book on your own. If you go to his office hours, he's really helpful
harddd and mean

comments: Mueller's courses are a waste of time and tuition money. He is knowledgeable, but incapable of demonstrating a point with any clarity or brevity. He is simply an extremely poor teacher. I wish I had read and heeded his reviews before enrolling in the course.

Martin Mueller is not a great lecturer. His voice sounds like a cross between Cobra Commander of G.I. Joe fame, and a regular man with a bat stuck in his throat. he can't stay on point to save his life. However, he knows a hell of a lot about Shakespeare. His digressions are often amusing. And he's one hell of a nice guy. Also, it's an easy A.
The worst teacher I've ever had, period.
WORST PROF AT NU. He's lost his damn mind. Classes are usless garble, quizzes compeltely arbitrary and foreign, it was misery.
Martin is a real unadulterated lecturer. His digressions are enthraling and you'll learn more from his many little known and sporadic facts than you have from anyone before.

159823.name: Arthur Schmidt
comments: JUST DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY AND TIME this is simply not worth it. He solves one problem (out of exam questionnaire for 40 min, ends up with the wrong answer, does 5-6 mistakes on the way. THOUGH, he gives 4 problems (as long as I've mentioned and 3 open questions and only one hour to go on the exam. I wonder if he would pass his own test?))))
Really great professor!

Lectures are excellent; great sense of humor. He explains complex material simply, with good demos. Skipping lecture = not a good grade on exams. He gives extra credit opportunities. If you want a good grade, pay attention, read the text, do the homework, and learn the material! Labs are easy if you prepare and know the material.

Don't even waste your time taking College Physics with Professor Schmidt. His lectures are totally useless and will only confuse. There is no order or structure to how he solves problems so you can't follow. He doesn't respond to emails and he took off on a sailing trip for 1/2 of the class! This was the worst instructor that I've ever had.

He's not really that helpful, his lectures are reallllly bad and the exams are ridiculous. The material is relatively easy but he blindsides you on tests with with stuff you've never seen before. Also, he can't teach. At all. Seriously.

Go to his office hours and just learn the stuff thoroughly. If he mentions something briefly in lecture learn it tight, part of his tests are pulling up little details, this separates A from B students. His tests are short and if he only tested major concepts everyone would get A's and then who would be the Chiropractors?

Awful communicator. Lectures are terribly disorganized. He reads from old notes and loses focus and direction frequently. Exams are tough, but curved. The labs for this class are ridiculous, and the lab manual is a riddle. Don't take this class with Schmidt. You have been warned.
LECTURES ARE USELESS. Tests are not comprised of lectures or homework. Just frustrating.
It would have been nice, if at least what were we told would be on the exam was on the exams, instead of stuff that had barely been mentioned in lecture.
just disappointing. given his glowing rep, you'd think the man'd be able to teach. oops! guess we were punked!
No Comments
He's pretty funny and helpful except his exam's harder. You will really have to understand the material to ace his exam.

Art Schmidt is a great professor. Always available to help, you just have to ask. Sit down with him - he can be hysterical. Considering he teaches Physics, he is pretty easy. If you're going to take Physics, take it with him, he's the only way to go.
No Comments
No Comments

Although her grading was tough and goes through material very quickly, its with the expectation that you read the material before class and you have 2 weeks to complete assignments. Her quizzes are hard, but its open notes and open book. Where she provides the most value is in her industry insight. Advice: stay ahead and ask industry questions
