Might was well try and learn to speak Arabic watching someone run through a slide deck for 3 hours. Knowledgeable but stubborn.

682799.name: Charles Yarnoff
comments: Awesome Awesome Awesome Never expected such a good writing instructor as an Engineering student

One of the best teachers I have ever had. He knows the literature very well, is an expert at leading discussions, and is an excellent writing instructor. And he's a great guy to just talk to.
No Comments
Great prof. Really interested in students' progress. Really helpful with adult students. CARES THAT YOU LEARN!!!!

1478167.name: Sara Broaders
comments: Great instructor and even gives ample opportunity to make up lost points.

Great teacher, she's clearly very knowledgeable in her field and she also teaches with great positive energy. Do the assigned readings and participate in class discussion and I promise, the quarter will fly by.

Really fun teacher, very interesting and knowledgable about what she teaches. I've taken several classes from her; she grades fairly, most of her exams are purely multiple choice. Exams are 75% lecture and 25% book, but she is always clear and is an amazing teacher. Need more teachers like her.

320692.name: Rifka Cook
comments: I took the class 121-3, Special Topics: Gastronomy and Identity. It was a great class, different than the others I took in Spanish. Among other things, we had the opportunity to speak with real chefs from different countries of Latinoamérica, and also we cooked.
She really cares about her students. She is a genuine person.
nicest prof out there. 10/10 would recommend. Very helpful and kind.
She's full of herself. Don't take her!
No Comments
her teaching style is very poor and doesn't do a good job explaining or helping.

892709.name: Sam Tepper
comments: A great Professor despite his Progressive rants
Sam is the most awesome prof, funny and easy on the eyes.
He's funny and cool

Sam is a great professor! He is laid back and awesome to listen too. He really wants you to learn and makes that clear to you from the first day of class. I have taken two classes with him and I'm hoping for a third sometime soon! If you get a chance to take one of Sam's classes, do yourself a favor, and take it! :)
I took 3 classes with Sam because he is GREAT!!! Before his classes I never thought that studying can be so entertaining. I learned a lot through a lot of fun!!!

Sam is really a great professor. He makes each class interesting by making it real, not just teaching theory. He also has real world experience since he has an actual day job so its even more cool that he keeps teaching. Everyone should take his classes.
I never wanted to miss this course! The prof WANTS you to get the info...and extends himself so that you do! You will never have a more informed/cool prof! SAMBO ROCKS!
Yeah, he's cool, he's funny, he's smart, and he keeps the class completely interested. High energy. GREAT prof!
No Comments
No Comments

No papers, attendence required or you have to write a sum. of the chapter,1 group project, class atmosphere is loose but tests are hard- but do-able. Profes. is cool as hell and better than most teachers at DePaul, the material for course is just boring and dry...
No Comments
so, this guy is pretty cool and funny. but he can be a real d*ck! his exams are impossible. but he's a pretty easy grader. i passed, and i didn't pay attention at all.

892534.name: John Paluch
comments: Johannes was a awesome professor. He was always availiable outside of office hours if needed. The accordian rules!
Best teacher EVER!

672082.name: John Bushnell
comments: He was my professor for 4 classes in the late 1980s and then my thesis advisor. He was the best professor I had at NU and one of the reasons I went on to study Russian history in grad school and teach today. I now send students off to NU with orders to take his classes!

History of the Soviet Union is his strong suit and he keeps it really interesting-we only read primary documents and typed lectures and the whole class we debate the writing-he will learn you name too

1298993.name: Ian Horswill
comments: Best Prof
One of the best professor at NU
What a boss.

158767.name: Craig Lamay
comments: I love him. One of my favourite professors from Northwestern. He's smart, outspoken, helpful, everything positive you can think of. Truly wonderful and you can learn A LOT from him!

I took jour 370 with LaMay and it was my favorite class I've taken at Medill. Unlike a lot of Medill professors who are self-righteous and preachy about journalism ethics, LaMay kept it real. He started out the class saying in his opinion this should be called media law since media ethics don't really exist. Going to class unnecessary but fun.
I love him. He is great, interesting to listen too and also talk to. And he's super attractive which is a bonus.
Craig is different. He can be really intense and he can also be the most easy going man in the world. Either way, he's memorable.
Beautiful, amazing man.
Lamay keeps it real. Ridiculously smart, a great speaker, completely approachable in and out of class. great guy.
Great lecturer. Not necessary to pay attention, but he is very interesting, so why not?
Craig is one of a kind.
wonderful teacher.
Lamay is easy going but also intense. It's what makes him such a good teacher, and such an attractive man.
he's a great speaker, but he's best one on one. remembers what it's like to be young. self deprecating but one of the smartest profs i had at nu.
Extremely intelligent, down to earth and understanding. One of my fave NU professors, seriously.
I had Lamay years ago and he was the best Medill prof then, intellectually one of the best I had at Nu and also one of the nicest. I use what he taught me everyday.
The nicest, smartest, hottest professor ever. One of the best I had at NU.
My FAVORITE Northwestern professor ever!
A very nice, very modest amd very smart man. never met anyone like him.
A really smart man who stands for what Medill is at its best. No one like him. And yes, he's really good looking in a rough around the edges kind of way.
Craig LaMay is what every man should aspire to be. His classes are the bomb and his older son is REALLY good looking. Def take a class with this guy!

I took his class years ago before going to work for a major metro paper. I have used everything he taught me and continue to respect him tremendously. One of the best teachers I ever had, undergrad and grad. He is so amazingly smart and well respected, yet utterly humble and approachable.
This guy is famous. great teacher, greater human beiing.

1015783.name: Joel Colom-Mena
comments: Colom-Mena makes the study of Spanish very interesting. He is eager to help the students to learn and is very attentive. Take his class if you want to learn and improve your mastery of Spanish.
If you want to take a really good Spanish course, take one from Joel. He cares a lot about his students,and if you really like Spanish, you will learn so much.

107470.name: Jorge Nocedal
comments: It?s clear that his conferences and research are far more important than his students. He sends his TA to teach while he?s away (which is quite a bit, according to former students), leaving us to teach ourselves from the book (which he wrote). He?s signed in more students than the space allows, which isn?t fair to students.
No Comments
class is a little abstract at first, but once you get it it's really easy
Scary class if you are not experienced with programming.
No Comments
No Comments

477340.name: John Mordacq
comments: Great guy, fantastic professor, really knows biology in a special sort of way I can only describe by example: he had us working as undergraduates in a now extremely popular field before most people knew how big it would become. Always around for office ours and to chat, you should take him!
Dude hes awesome. Just watch out for bad jokes.

Dr. M is very laid back and cool, but make ridiculous tests and quizzes and is unwilling to budge on grades (I was 1.5 points aways from a B- and he refused to give it to me). Class is a waste of time because he flies through his lecture slides and tests you on the entire book- every week is like finals week.
He wants to help and he wants to be clear, but it just doesn't come out that way. His quizzes were ridiculous. I had no idea what they were asking and I did read all the material.

Worst lectures, worst tests. The man lectures like he's on speed, and he usually can't answer it if someone does manage to squeeze a question in there. His tests are ridiculous and poorly phrased. He wanted to be a doctor, but he's not, so he's taking it out on his students.

934886.name: Nitasha Sharma
comments: She's super smart, knows her stuff an is wonderful at managing teacher-student, peer to peer dynamics. If you're the least bit insecure about learning from a really smart woman who also happens to be kind as well as progressive in terms of student-teacher power dynamics, you'll struggle.

Nice woman, but not the brightest bulb. Nor the sharpest pencil. Etc. Tries hard to be like the students and seems to need our approval, rather than being the professor and an authority. Acts young, needs to face up to being older. We WANT you to be professorial. Don't act like a kid. Should get better, I'll bet.

966410.name: Wing Kam Liu
comments: A terrible lecturer
Worst teacher ever

809504.name: Chris Hield
comments: I took Chris for 3 classes (PM, IT PM, and Obj. Oriented Programming). His lectures tend to run long, but he is very detailed and specific as to what his expectations are. The work does take a while, but if you hang in there you will be just fine. I would for sure take his class again.

The assignments are pretty easy to follow, and he walks you through them during his mandatory lectures. Some assignments can be done in 1 hour, some can take up to 5 hours, but it's never hard. If you don't understand something or still have questions, it's pretty easy to message him and he responds pretty fast.

Great professor. Make sure you don't skip the sync sessions. He goes over the assignments and does most of the assignment for you if you watch them. If you watch the sync sessions, you will just be fine in this class. Quizzes are not easy but final exam basically comes from your quiz questions.

Knowledgeable professor on the topic of IT Project management. He is a fair grader and will provide feedback on homework. He can be picky at times, but not tough. The course is not as difficult as CIS 494 and requires more papers and less project management tools. Repeats a lot of what was taught in that course less the practical skills.

Professor is a knowledge expert on the subject of project management. His lectures are structured and fill up the entire 3 hours of class time each week. Pay attention to the details of the weekly assignment as he will take off points for the smallest details. No quizsexams only weekly assignments which seem to take longer than planned.
He does a very good job of explaining the material, and the homework is hard, but fair, as it is necessary for learning the material.

I had Professor Hield for Project Management, and was not sure what to expect. His lectures were clear and to the point which i really appreciated (aprrox an hour each week). During the sync session, he thoroughly went over how to do homework. Make sure to follow the directions on the syllabus exactly. I would def take him again.
Clear and thorough lync sessions. Good assignment overviews. Feed back on assignments.
Teaches Java, and instead of running the samples on Netbeans, he writes them on the board. Very difficult to understand his handwriting.
Not Recommended

Helped a lot with object oriented programming
Best professor ever. Really. He had a lot of his own notes. I am surprised he had not published his own book. Extremely useful class.

Well organized...I actually learned a lot in his classes!
Very nice guy. Lenient grader. Very clear when it comes to exams, and projects. Very accessible via email.

I watched these lectures on the mediasite website and boy am I glad I skipped this class. Its a little harsh the way she was acting and she came across as rude the way she was putting down the students.
She is slightly below average, but an easy A if she likes you.

Anna was very engaging in this class however she wasn't very comfortable with the material. It was awkward seeing her stumble through what she was teaching. A little on the off side but overall an average teacher at best.

Where to start, unclear on her material, rude, abrasive, and very condescending. She openly mocks and belittles the students for making points. She is a tough grader and she is quite honestly the class you regret you took.

1590913.name: Jeffrey Gott
comments: Jeff is very organized and gives you all the assignments up front. There is a fair amount of work each week, but if you manage your time effectively, you can get ahead of schedule. I finished the course 10 days early so I could start summer sooner. You will learn a ton.

Bad: u have 2 read A TON of stuff. Then u have the written assignment each class and then u have 2 post on the forum + 2 projects (mine is 35pg). Jeff is 2 strict about timing. Good: professor is awesome I loved his lectures. He is very professional+clear to understand. I am not native & can't do much useless verbage, so I ended up with B-
